name: restorable
content:

that can be returned to an earlier good condition or position: Although the tools were damaged, he thought that they were probably restorable. There were some marks and even a couple of scratches, but the expert believed that the painting was restorable.
More examplesFewer examplesThe original settings on the phone are easily restorable at any time.The colours of the landscape were dulled and dirty but restorable to their original brilliance.This was once a very fine piece of ceramic, but I'm afraid it's simply not restorable.
